Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel dore”
Reviews.Author: honestjohnsalt
Reviews.Content: On the Friday 6th of April we arrived not knowing what we was going to do for the weekend. Without asking the lady in the reception took 20mins of her time to point out (on the map that they provide) all the hot spots in Paris and any problems with metro she gave us good advice. She also gave us a smaller map of the area around the hotel with bars, shops, places to eat and cash points ect. This was very helpful. The lift was small but not to bad I'm a big person 20st, me and my wife managed to get in with a big case. The room was also small but was well cleaned and serviced. The bath room shower was good you could fit 2 people in it. Bed was just a double but also managed to fit. On easter Sunday when we was out in town the staff put a bag of small easter eggs on out bed with a note saying that we hope you have enjoyed your stay and have a happy easter that was a nice touch. Breakfast was simple but also filling continental breakfast that you can help yourself to. The hotel was very close to the metro. Easy to use and one line to the eiffle tower. All metro lines are numbered and go on colours. Paris its self was lovely apart for the men that try and sell you stuff and do take your 1st no they are around all the main places. Other than that it was a nice stay and would recommend it to anyone looking to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Christina K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights at the beginning of April 2012. The hotel is comfortable, clean and a good base for visiting the city. Staff are very friendly and most can speak English, Breakfast is a buffet comprising cereal, fruit, toast, pastries, ham and cheese. The coffee is fabulous. There is no bar or restaurant. Ok, rooms are small, but not as tiny as I had been led to believe by the other reviews. Our room was big enough, clean, everything worked and we slept really well in a comfortable bed. The district isn't central, but it's a nice "real Paris" area, and there's a Metro almost next to the hotel. Once we understood the way the Metro works, it was easy to get to everywhere from Daumesnil, and not expensive if you get a 5-day ticket for central Paris. It takes about 20 minutes to get from here to all the central big tourist spots. This is definitely not a rough area, and anyone who thinks it is should visit Montmartre or some of the more western districts. We came across homeless people and beggars and con-artists everywhere in Paris, most noticeably around the major tourist sites. For the cost, this hotel is absolutely exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “ruined our experience ..”
Reviews.Author: touristkev
Reviews.Content: i book the hotel and flights threw lastminute.com for me and my girlfriend .. the information on the site about the hotel led me to believe that it maybe small but a lovely place .. when i arrived at the hotel i thought i was in the wrong place .. on a street in a town which in my view was quite rough homeless ppl everywhere and prey on those hoilday makers as sooon as they hear you speak english they are giving you notes on how family have died and they want your money .. apart from being near a metro line leading to tourist attractions such as the eiffel tower and arc de triomphe there is little around to do thou we did find a lovely pizza place where we where very welcome .. when we checked into the hotel it was very empty and when we went into our room it was as said very small when looking at the bathroom i noticed that the ceiling sagged not a little but loads .. we was then moved room into a single which was even smaller .. we also payed for breakfast which we never got due to the dinning room being tiny and the hotel is doesnt offer dinner its not really a hotel more like a bog standard b&b ... i will never being staying there again ...

Reviews.Title: “Small But Good”
Reviews.Author: 0923Steve
Reviews.Content: Spent Three nights in the Hotel Dore in Early march. The rooms are small and you have to navigate around each other but they are very clean and warm. The bathroom again is small but very functioal with toilet shower and basin all well maintained and clean. The towels were changed every day. The lift is very small two people max or one with cases, a little rickarty. Staff were friendly and helpful, spoke English better than my French.The breakfast area is small and can get a little crowded when the Hotel is busy . Close to Metro and a few restaurants, although the Hotel does not serve Alcohol there is a small supermarket close by if you wish to buy and drink in your room. and yes I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Grand about it...”
Reviews.Author: orderedsteps
Reviews.Content: I understand Paris is an expensive city, and yes I appreciate finding a decent hotel at a decent price is a challenge. Though I anticipated a small room, I have to admit that I was truly stunned when I saw the room and realized what small really meant. It was minuscule and almost impossible to accommodate my husband and I with our suitcases. I know that when you go to Paris you don't expect to stay in the room, but the size and decor was actually uncomfortable and I felt claustrophobic. I could barely open my suitcase as there was just no space. We stayed only 2 nights - on our way back from Nice - and i don't think I could have managed much more than that. The only reasons why I haven't given it a lower score, is that there were some conveniences which I have to account for. Without these, I really don't think it would be worth more than two TA dots. So, if these are important to you, here were the good points about the hotel for us: 1. Free Wi-fi 2. Continental Breakfast included (though limited seating) 3. Short walk to Daumensil metro and close to Gare de Lyon station (where we arrived on our train from Nice) 4. Mini fridge with complimentary water 5. Kettle with tea, coffee and biscuits

Reviews.Title: “The grand Grand Dore, Paris”
Reviews.Author: majamAustralia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made an internet booking for the the Grand Dore for our Paris stay of five days last October. We were very pleased with our selection, a relatively small hotel in an attractive part of Paris. It may look to be a little out of the centre of the city, but it is very close to a Metro station and with trains every few minutes, getting to other parts of Paris is easy and quick... and inexpensive if one buys the appropriate Metro pass. Our comfortable room overlooked a grand, wide Parisian boulevarde with rows of trees breaking up the traffic lanes. Daumesnil offers a good selection of eating places where great evening meals can be had at a reasonable price . We found the hotel staff to be happy,friendly, efficent people who did everything possible to make us welcome. Although our arrival time was at about 11 pm, this presented no problem. The lift/elevator which we took to our room was perfectly Parisian...it accomodated one person plus our luggage. When we asked advice about the best way of getting to various places, they invariably gave helpful, accurate information. Our room, though not large, was fine. It overlooked the magnificent Ave Daumesnil. We had a grandstand view of Paris life, but noise from the street was not a problem. On days when we had breakfast there, it was excellent When we were leaving and decided that a taxi to Gare du Nord would be appropriate, they had a cab there for us within a minute. The Grand Dore has a cosy, friendly charm and atmosphere... everything we could wish for, without the impersonal feeling that one sometimes senses in more glamourous establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Good but far”
Reviews.Author: guorlan
Reviews.Content: A good place, but you need to prepare for a lot of Metro travelling (about 7 € per person/day's worth). The Hotel is not big, nor are the rooms, but they are spotlessly clean. Bath linen is changed daily, and the room and mattresses in good condition. Breakfast is adequate for the category and staff helpful and polite. On the minus side, you need to take two metros to get to the center and the trip is between 30 and 40 minutes and there are no internet cafes nearby, : the hotel has no computer for internet access for guests (it does have WiFi but I did not try it). No telephone price list is available, and calls are expensive

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: FirebrandFox
Reviews.Content: This was my best experience in hotel selections in Paris so far. The hotel is well located (right next to a metro stop and within a 10-15 min metro trip of most areas), clean and well appointed. The room's are Paris-style small, but fine. The bathroom's are nice and new. Reasonable rates for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “AS USUAL....EXCELLENT..!!”
Reviews.Author: WITHIES
Reviews.Content: Stayed there again over the New Year 2011...up to its usual standard...friendly staff, clean and comfortable room and very good continental breakfast included in the price of the room. The room has tea and coffee making facilities and a fridge...Will use again on the next trip to Paris. It is well situated, about 15/20 minutes from the Eiffel Tower ( on the Metro), and there are several good restaurants around, plus several excellent shops and food halls. Can't say enough good things about the Hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel, great location and free breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: TomGuppy
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris for the second time at the start of December 2011 with my partner. We chose the hotel on tripadvisor after doing a bit of research. It was just under £100 per night, and we stayed for three nights, very very reasonable for Paris, as most hotels are above £150per night, plus you get a continental breakfast for free. Which is a bargain seems a coffee is about 5Euros in Paris! The receptionist was fantastic, recommended a place for us to go in the evening for food and drink and was generally very helpful. The rooms, as everyone else says, are very very small, there is hardly room around the bed and not much room to put your suitcase down. However, how much time are you going to spend in your room when your in Paris? Except for sleeping, we were out all day and night, only slept at the hotel. The hotel is right outside the Daumesnil station, fab location, restaurants and shops around the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would go back... no need to look around anymore, book it, except for room size, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: TrippyPop
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here in sept for an anniversary trip away, we had a great deal on the hotel through last minute, I didn't want to spend too much on a hotel as I knew we would be out all day and most of the night! The rooms are small as others have said but when in Paris how much time are you really going to spend inside a hotel? Hotel staff were very friendly and excellent customer service, nothing was too much trouble and the hotel was spotless! It is in a residential area of Paris but the metro line (station Daumesnil) is literally outside the hotel and to the right for a few yards, you can be at the Eiffel Tower in 15 mins! The beauty of its location is places to eat and drink, being residential and popualted by true parisians the prices are much lower than you would expected in Paris, you could have 3 wines for the price of one in this area compared to the Boulv S. Michelle! I highly recommend the metro cafe across the road to the hotel, we ate there most nights! Great hotel and fantastic location for a romantic and authentic experience of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Rubee369
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the metro station Daumesnil (line 6 - green), a few mins walk. It takes about 20 mins to reach the centre of Paris. The room was small, but surprising has most facilities expected, even a hairdryer in the bathroom which was very useful and also a small fridge in the bedroom. The staff were very kind and helpful especially Geraldine who helped us alot with getting around the city. She even gave me some lemon tea and honey (free of charge) when i came down with a cold. She was very sweet and friendly ! One tip - It is better to bring your own towels, as the towels in the hotel are very rough and gave me a rash on my face, as I have very sensitive skin. The breakfast was very good, typically continental ie yoghurt, fruit salad, crossaints, pain au chocolat etc. Small breakfast area, about 4 tables, but we always found it empty because we used to have breakfast after 9am. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Paddym84
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review about a hotel before. I've stayed in 5* hotels all over the world for business, but I decided to stay in a budget hotel in Paris because I knew I wouldn't be spending much time indoors. I was there with my fiancé and we had a lot of sightseeing to do. It was our first time in Paris, so we spent 15 mins working out the directions to the hotel. Very easy to find, but you should get to grips with the metro system first. It cost us around 7 euros for a weekend pass on the metro. It took us everywhere and it's very easy with the map provided by the hotel. You get the RER B from the airport, then change and get the RER A, then change onto the metro and get off at daumesnil. Very cheap and very easy. The room size has been exaggerated. Ok, they are not massive, but there was plenty of room. Very clean and modern. The lift is small, but it's just a lift. The metro station is actually only a 20 second walk. It's practically on the doorstep. Very safe area. Very helpful staff. Our breakfast was included. I don't understand the comments about having to pay for breakfast. We had no hassle. I will be back to Paris next year as 3 days isn't enough. I was hesitant about staying here because of previous comments about room size etc but I'm glad I ignored them. Perfect hotel in a great location. Why spend a fortune on an overpriced hotel, when you won't be in it most of the time? We used the extra money to go out and shop and drink (we're Irish!)

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: alfred e
Reviews.Content: Most things in Paris are expensive but for our long weekend stay the Grand Hotel Dore represented good value for money particularly when taking into account the Friendliness and helpfulness of the hotel staff . Would be quite happy to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Few things disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RRLondra
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on it being close to business I had to attend. Paying on average about £100 a night, I expected a little more, even if Paris is an expensive city for hotels. The room was very small, which I knew before. But there was no heater in the washroom (and no heated towel rack, either). This isn't a problem in the spring and summer. But when it's fall and winter, a different story. When I brought this up with one of the receptionists, he abruptly said that's the way it's been for 100 years. Doesn't make it right, does it? This same gentlemen seemed bothered, too, when I told him that a light wasn't working in my room. He huffed and puffed before, and during, changing the light. Totally unprofessional. He got annoyed in the first place because I didn't know how to use the safe. Problem was, a very important piece of the instructions regarding the safe was left out. Geraldine was always helpful, though. The second day, when I came back from work, my door was left open, probably by housekeeping, as in, my key didn't work but I was still able to open the door with virtually no force. And here was the kicker. The receptionist on the final day, an elderly petite woman, said I didn't need to book a cab to get to the train station. All I had to do was come down, she said, she'd call one, and it would be there in 5-10 mins. So I did that. I went down at 9 am. No cab at 9:10. No cab at 9:20. Finally a cab at 9:30. I told her that I was ticked because she said I didn't have to call a cab before hand, which she didn't appreciate. The thing was - and she's likely the owner of the hotel - there was a taxi stand about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. What kind of service is that? She couldn't tell me this? This is the kind of place for the most part that if you keep quiet, they'll treat you fine. If there's an issue and you bring it, they get upset. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and fine if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Lucinda101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Grand Dore for 2 nights whilst visiting Paris for work. Paris is an extremely expensive city and finding a reasonably priced hotel was pretty hard work, this hotel was less expensive than most, but at £100 per night I was expecting a little better than what I found (seriously, I've stayed in far better Travelodges...). The best thing about the hotel is it's location, very close to Daumensil metro station which is only a few stops from the city centre. The area seemed pretty safe and there were bars, restaurants and supermarkets very close by. Contrary to other reviewers I found that the staff did not speak a word of English, they were pleasant enough though. My room was on the 6th floor, a tiny rickety lift went as far as the 5th floor and I had to carry my bags up the last flight of stairs. The room was absolutely tiny with hardly any space to move around in, although this seems to be common in Paris, and there was only a shower and no bath in the bathroom. The bed was very hard and extremely uncomfortable and the aircon did't work making the room strangely hot considering the weather outside, opening the window made it too noisy to sleep. Everything was reasonably clean unless you looked in the corners where I found dust and hairs, and despite being in a non-smoking room everything still smelled faintly of cigarette smoke. So basically I hardly slept and would definitely not return, this hotel is fine if you're on a budget but otherwise I'd look elsewhere and spend a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Friendly place”
Reviews.Author: SRS77
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel on trip advisor, and was keen as it has some great reviews. The hotel was easy to reach from airport and a minutes walk from the Daumesnil Metro. There was a bit of a wait for our room, even though we arrived after 2pm check in time. The room was on floor and was quite small, though clean with a lovely view of the location. The breakfast area is also very small with five tables, so a bit limited for space. The staff very friendly and helpful. A great little hotel for putting your head down. No more than 10mins to the centre of Paris and a few good restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel, convenient for the price.”
Reviews.Author: AppanSub
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at Hotel Dore in September 2011. We read a lot of reviews about this hotel and settled on this one. Sure enough, we had smallish room with a smallish bathroom but with a really great shower. We slept well on the one bed in a quiet, corner room on the 5th level. (Hint: Larger sized persons might find the hotel rooms too small.)Plenty of places to eat nearby, including a Subway and a Big Mac,not too far. Most importantly, the metro station (Daumesnil) is right next to the hotel, so after loading up with a "continental" breakfast in the hotel, we were off each day to explore the city with a "carnet" of tickets in hand. Getting to Versailles was easy: number 8 metro to Invalides and change to RER train. (Buy the ticket at the metro station to go all the way).Buying metro tickets at the station is also a snap using the machines. Overall, the quiet hotel was perfect for us, made even more terrific by the receptionists all of whom were able to converse with us in English and were unstinting in their efforts to help us with maps, directions, places to visit etc. Kudos to Geraldine and Claire for their assistance in making our stay most pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bigger than expected.”
Reviews.Author: FerrMasli
Reviews.Content: We were surprised to find our room bigger that expected for Paris (after reading all the reviews prior to our stay). We were welcomed by Géraldine who was extremely nice and helpul. She gave us all important information on the hotel (including wifi, breakfast and other services), on nearby restaurants and boulangeries and on local activities. The room was very clean and spacious and everything worked fine (wifi, tv, shower, etc). The bed was quite comfortable. Breaskfast was good (we were able to get a deal by booking on the internet) with coffee, viennoiseries, juices, cheeses, yogurts, etc. Well situated near Daumesnil metro stion (line 6).

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: deckard34
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a two night trip in Paris. Helpful staff and a very clean hotel. Yes the rooms are small so if your big folks with large cases this isn’t the place for you. However we were travelling light and it's in a nice area with a bar/restaurant, corner shop and the Metro station all within a few steps A couple of nice touches were the complimentary mineral water in the fridge and a kettle (A rarity in France) Would return

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: aquaman88
Reviews.Content: negative : tiny rooms . tiny bathroom . staff doesn't speak good English ! postive : next to the metro station . clean . good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in the hotel. My major dislike was the bed, I think another review mentioned the incontinence sheet on the bed and how hot it made it. Because of this, I didn't sleep well at all for the first 2 nights. However, the next 3 nights we opened the French doors a little, and luckily the traffic wasn't too noisy. However, the rest of our experience in the hotel was fine, the rooms are on the small side as several people have already mentioned, but it's only a place to sleep, how much time are you going to spend in the hotel room with a city like Paris to explore?! The breakfast was enjoyable, I'm more of a fry up person, but the croissants etc were very nice. All in all, good value for money and close to the metro. I've said it before and I'll say it again - if you expect a 5* hotel, then pay for a 5* hotel! At these prices, one can't complain!

Reviews.Title: “Great, great, great...”
Reviews.Author: mgalmo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a friend. The location was perfect for us, about a block from the Metro. Our flight arrived so early that we concerned that our room would not be available to us. The staff was wonderful, they held onto our luggage for us until it was ready. Just that was so helpful (we had packed for a month) that we did not have to take it with us while we went sightseeing. The staff were very helpful in getting us orientated to the city and made recommendations for us to get where we wanted to go more smoothly. Clean, very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Our wonderful experience"”
Reviews.Author: coopermanBrighton
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at the hotel from Thurs 22nd Sept to Mon 26th Sept. We have read many comments about the size of the room and the small lift but we thought it just added to the character of the hotel. Breakfast was great and plenty of it. Staff could not have been more welcoming and helpfull. Location was great and right by the Metro line which got us into the center of Paris in about 15 minutes. There is a local street market on Tuesdays and Fridays just along from the Hotel which is lovely, there are great stalls with fish, meats, jewellery veg and much more. Yes, the room we stayed in was small but we found the wardrobe adequate for our clothes and to be honest Paris was so breathtaking that once we had breakfast, we were gone and only returned to shower in the great shower cubicle and go to bed. All in all my wife absolutely loved it and can't wait to go back, hope she takes me again !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value, elegant neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Monica V
Reviews.Content: We were there after reading many excellent reviews on trip advisor and elsewhere and we haven't been disappointed (a special note for trip advisor which allows people to post a little story about their experience..). Pros: Everything was very good, the staff (with a special note for Amin who was greeting us warmly every evening when coming back from another day in Paris..), the atmosphere and quietness, the room and bathroom, the breakfast, the neighborhood, the location and the connections with metro and bus (29 downtown, and 351 - from Nations- to cdg airport), the street market every Tuesday and Friday, supermarkets within 5 minutes walk (Monoprix, Simply, Franprix) etc. Overall, one has the feeling of a family hotel. Also the guests who choose to stay there are very nice, quiet and polite ;) We will definitely stay there again. Cons: The door that covers the plumbing (a tile in fact) in the bathroom let some bad smell to come in, better isolation there would be necessary I guess. Also for people staying more than a weekend, the breakfast becomes boring, as they don't ever change the offer (that is tasty nevertheless). People who are full figured should be aware that the door to some of the rooms is less than 70 cm wide, the same for the shower's door. Traveling with a lot of luggage can be also a problem in some of the rooms. For people traveling to Paris for the first time, please be aware that the closing time of attractions and stores (supermarkets included) is the time they actually close the store, and usually they don't let you in 15-20 minutes before that time. Also, if you are still inside, they will effectively push you out, being very rude while doing that. Actually the myth of the French being rude, despite speaking French, is so true!.. Of course, we've met very nice French people, polite, educated and helpful.. for example, the "fromage" expert from the Androuet fromagerie in Mouffetard Street, near the Pantheon. Though, the majority of French working in services are initially polite, before you open your mouth to say smth. When they realize you speak French like a foreigner, they will suddenly become hurried to see you out of their store.. I've noticed this symptom in many big towns that are major tourist attractions, except for London, but in Paris it is the worst..

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Magnus45
Reviews.Content: We had a mid week break in Paris - my first trip there apart from a one day trip many years ago. So, with some trepidation, two seventy year olds set out from London on the EuroStar for Gare du Nord on 23rd August. We would not have been as familiar with the Paris Metro as we are with the London underground but we did find our way to the Gare de Lyon. We decided to walk from the Gare de Lyon to our hotel - on hindsight we should have taken a metro to the station local to the hotel - much quicker! The receptionist, Geraldine, was very helpful & furnished us with all kinds of maps & aids of Paris. We had asked for a quiet room when we booked & were allocated room 108. The room was small but we had expected this from the reviews we had read prior to our departure for Paris. The bathroom was very adequate with an excellent shower unit & everything that is required for a short stay, including a hairdryer. The bedroom had an excellent air conditioning unit & not too noisy. It also had a flat screen TV & coffee/tea making facilities. My only reservation with the bedroom was the under blanket on the bed - it was designed for persons with incontinence problems. This gave the effect, on hot nights, that a very hot electric blanket was on maximum heat. Maybe I should have brought this to their attention but chose not to. The breakfasts were to our taste - we don't go for the full English type - plenty of cold meats, cheese, cereals, yoghurts, spreads, rolls & toasting bread. All in all, a good little hotel, reasonably priced and very pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on Avenue Daumesnil”
Reviews.Author: mickeeD
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Dore was a clean, friendly, and reasonably priced hotel on the east side of the City. The Metro was a just a short distance away and was situated within a 15-20 minute stroll from the Bastille and Le Marais. The room was a good size and was always clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn G
Reviews.Content: Superb position for metro (30 seconds away) in very pleasant area. Breakfast was good with choice of cereal, fruit, croissants, even pain au chocolat(!), ham, cheese, pure fruit juice, good coffee, and great that they served this until 10.30 each day. Room was fine if on small side. Unbelievably, I left my credit and debit cards behind in the safe (well I did say, unbelievably!). Received call following afternoon at home from holiday company who said Hotel Reception had called them to let them (and me) know, and that they awaited my further instructions. Hotel had also rung Eurostar who had flashed up notice for us on departure screens in Paris but which we hadn't seen. Even more unbelievably, I hadn't even noticed lack of cards since I was using up the euros on way home. Stopped cards immediately of course, and hotel sent them back to me with priority posting and nice accompanying letter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rolf92
Reviews.Content: Nice charming hotel, very close to Metro-stations. Typical nice Paris surroundings. But very small rooms, and the breakfast-room has very limited number of chairs..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Adamsma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. The room was lovely and clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Although a not central it is right next to a metro station and was a short metro ride from everywhere we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Gary_Faulkner
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find when leaving the Metro station and we were made very welcome by the reception staff. The room is typical compact for Paris, but then you only sleep there. There is a fridge in the room, along with tea & coffee making facilities. The bathroom was clean and reasonably large, (I have had smaller). Free wi-fi was available in the room which was an added bonus, along with air conditioning which was required during to the temperature being very hot and sunny. Breakfast was plentiful and typical continental style of breakfast, consisting of pastries, bread, meat & cheeses. The breakfast room is a bit small, but I would imagine this would only be a problem, if residents arrive around the same time, which dis not happen during our stay. Ate at the Le Metro as recommended by the hotel and the food was very good. The hotel is in a quiter area of Paris and would consider staying here again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but hot”
Reviews.Author: durhamd
Reviews.Content: We got a very reasonable deal on this hotel so should not be too critical. The room was very small, classed as double but should really have been a single. For April the weather was very hot, there was air conditioning but could not get it to come on making the room very hot. The continental breakfast was served in a small area just to the side of the main reception consisting of half a dozen tables. The surrounding streets did not feel very touristy, there are some bars nearby, a couple of expensive restaurants, cake shops and a small supermarket. It is quite a travel into the centre of Paris which is best reached by Metro,the entrance to Daumesnil station is about 100 yards from the hotel. If you can get a very good price I would recommend this hotel, however if there is anywhere more central I would stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: nicolas_cm
Reviews.Content: Close to the Metro, restaurants and shops but still quiet at night. Great service but the room was a bit smelly and out of date. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with clean modern facilities”
Reviews.Author: labman20
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the many reviews on this site, so wasn't disappointed when we arrived. Yes the rooms are small, but perfectly formed. Ensuite bathroom was bijou, shower was amazing with the side jets turned on. The lift is cosy, says it'll fit 4 but it was a squeeze with 3 in it, amusing all the same. We stayed on the 4th floor overlooking the rear of the building, view not spectacular but didn't feel over looked or lacking any privacy. Throwing the windows open allowed a lovely breeze in if we didn't want the air-con on, which probably has the cooling capacity to chill the sun if we wanted. The breakfast was simple and plentiful and always topped up, I hate when some hotels take forever to replenish items. It was also included in the price of the room which Lastminute didn't tell us, we only discovered this when the receptionist told us which was a nice surprise. The helpful staff gave us the local restaurant sheet with recommendations, but it fails to mention a real gem. Go down the road and pop in to Au Tramway, it had suburb food and the service was excellent, the waiter we had was more than happy to explain the menu in his best English. We ate there twice it was so good. Travelling around is easy as the hotel is next to the Metro station, We didn't bother with the Paris Visite thingy. My French friend who lives in Paris says they're a rip off for tourists. Instead we got the simple Mobilis day ticket, unlimited journeys on the Metro (no real need to use the RER, or buses) for 6euros. Or just get a single journey ticket for 1.70euro and use the BatoBus on the seine. All in all a lovely little hotel away from the masses and will definitely stay here again if we visit Paris in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “lovely family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poczech
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor. I was booking a sightseeing trip for my mum for her birthday and we were looking for a comfy hotel that was reasonably priced and well connected by public transport for our 5 days in Paris. I thought this fit the bill and I was not disappointed. Yes the rooms are small but so are most hotel rooms in Paris and how much time do you spend in the hotel room when there is such a beautiful city to explore? Our room was on the third floor with a view onto the street. The room was lovely and clean, the bed was very comfy and the shower was great. There was a safe in the room and air conditioning which was useful as it was very hot while we were there. Breakfast was included and there was a nice selection of croissants and pastries as well as cereals, bread, ham cheese and yogurt and although the eating area is small we didn't find it a problem - only having to wait a couple of minutes one day while the table was cleaned. The staff were very helpful - I speak French but I heard them speaking English with other guests and we asked for recommendations of where to eat nearby and the lady on reception provided a list and said which ones she thought were nice. We ate at Au Metro across the road on the first night as I'd read good reviews of it on here and we also had a lovely meal at Le Petit Troo. The hotel is one block from the Daumesnil metro which is very handy for sightseeing and it is located on a nice street in a less touristy part of Paris. We bought 5 day Paris visitors passes at the airport and they were invaluable for the trip. We used them to get the train from the airport and used them on the metro and trams throughout our stay, including a day trip to Versailles. I would recommend this hotel for a visit to Paris as it was clean, comfy, well connected, good value for money and the staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A great balance of quality and price in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Canuck2103
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews in advance of my reservation so I had good expectations of this place. The location is really good - only 1 minute walk to the subway entrance. Breakfast is plentiful and in an all you can eat format, which is good because food in Paris is so expensive. The dining area only has 4 tables of 4 though, so you may share your breakfast table with others - not a big deal though. The rooms are clean and for me, and that's the most important thing. I don't mind that they rooms are small, but there was only one electrical outlet in the whole room, and it wasn't in the bathroom so every night when we had to recharge our devices, there was some juggling around to do. As well, you won't be able to use your razor in the bathroom where there a mirror. The biggest downside (and why I didn't give 5/5) is that you could hear the subway clearly the whole night every time it passed under the hotel. We were on the "first" floor, so maybe if you're higher it's OK. Anyway, we were so tired everyday it didn't bother us that much. The WIFI was intermittent (sometimes fast, sometimes non-existant), but you can get better reception by dropping into the lobby area downstairs. All in all, I would definitely return to this hotel next time I'm in town if the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: zippymonkey
Reviews.Content: In a city where a rat-ridden hovel can command exorbitant rates, the Grand Hotel Dore is a breath of good value fresh air. Situated a mile or so east of Gare de Lyon, but right next to Daumesnil Metro, the location is ideal for a quick hop to many parts of Paris. The rooms are small, clean and have everything you need, including free wifi. The morning breakfast was ample, and - being France - awash with luscious croissants and pastries. Recommended for those who don't appreciate the feeling of being ripped off in Paris - although the rooms are expensive, this is unavoidable, and at least here you get a clean, decent hotel and warm welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Karseat
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were very satisfied with our stay at this hotel. The rooms were very clean. As usual for Paris, the room was small, but there was a large window in our bedroom that opened completely and the window in the bathroom could open and had a vent on it. We could leave the window open all night because it was completely quiet outside at night. The hotel has free Wifi in every room, and our room had a flat screen tv, kettle, mini-fridge, and hair dryer. No bathtub, but the shower stall was lovely, with a fine mist steam function. Everything inside the hotel looked new, and our room was cleaned thoroughly every day. The front staff were polite and helpful, and spoke sufficient English to answer our questions. The continental breakfast was nice- little cheeses, juice, coffee and pastries. There was a metro stop less than a block away. We will definitely stay here the next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: F0xtrot0scar
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, exceptionally clean rooms and bathroom. Rooms were small but I was expecting that because it’s Paris. The lift is tiny but good fun. Only criticism is the breakfast area is very small so your romantic weekend may start off by having breakfast with another couple at the same table wishing they were on their own to. Not a major problem though. Staff were brilliant and couldn't do enough. We were on the second floor and you could faintly hear the metro going past underneath. Area seems very safe to be out at night and there are plenty of bars and restaurants in the area so you don't have to dine in the busy areas in the city. Metro is very close so you can be near the attractions very quickly. I would definitely stay at this hotel again when I am next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrandmsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms are quite small but this is Paris after all and the hotel is very reasonably priced. I would definitely stay here again, the breakfast were simple but really good and there was free wifi which worked well. Getting to the Eiffel tower is really easy via one tram line and the nearest metro is only a 2 minute walk. There's also a lovely deli that sell great salads, baguettes, and pastries etc about 15 shops down which we went to repeatedly! The service is what truely stood out though, they were so helpful with all of our queries. Making bookings, printing tickets off for us, and even helped us out with a laundry service when we really needed it! Well above what I'd expect from a hotel like this!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: nphmacungie
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently spent 2 weeks in Paris and stayed at the Grand Hotel Dore. We could not have been more pleased! Having traveled in Europe before, I am accustomed to being "surprised" by my accomodations, but usually in a negative way. Not so with the Hotel Dore. First surprise was being given two beds instead of the one double that I thought we would be sleeping in. Next was the cleanliness - amazing! Towels were plentiful and changed out daily (again - not always the norm for Europe), and the room was neatly made up every day. It also was equipped with new air conditioning that actually worked! Breakfast was typical: cereal, breads, fruit, meats & cheese, but always fresh and delicious. The front desk staff was consistently friendly and helpful. The hotel is located in the 12th arrondisement which is not exactly "tourist central", but we found this to be a plus as well. After a busy day of sightseeing and rushing about, it was wonderful to come home to our quiet neighborhood to unwind and relax. And being a neighborhood setting, there were plenty of local markets, patisseries and bistros to enjoy. We would most definitely stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: nalbr027
Reviews.Content: Very good experience. We used the subway as our only mode of transportation so having the Daumsnil station only 30 seconds away from the hotel was a huge bonus. Location was perfect.  None of the sights were more than 30min on subway and staying out of the central paris chaos was refreshing. The room was typical for Paris (small) but that is expected. It was very clean and modern. There was a small fridge in the room which we used to keep our water/OJ after shopping at the grocery store about 5 min down the street. Front desk staff was very friendly. Free wifi internet in room was fast. There is a great French bakery next door for morning croissants and baguettes for lunch. Subway/rail transit to CDG is 1:15 min which is easy, cheap, and faster than driving. The bad? Not much at all!!!  Perhaps a free breakfast? (instead of charging 10 euros). Perhaps more English tv stations? (only 2 channels... BBC & CNBC). Ice machine in lobby? Would stay again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for in life.....this hotel is no exception”
Reviews.Author: pudsontour
Reviews.Content: I am sure there some nice rooms at the Grand Hotel Dore.....unfortunately ours wasn't one of them. There is nothing Grand about the Grand Hotel Dore, it should be renamed Very Basic Hotel Dore. We were on the 6th floor but the tiny lift only went up to the 5th floor with no offer of help with the luggage. The room and bathroom were very small and basic with only the shower offering any decent performance. I am 6'2'' and had trouble using the loo it was so small. At least we had full use of the mini bar - trouble was it only had a tin of sparkling water and a bottle of still water in it! LOL! The hotel is located in a nice suburb of Paris with several good cafes, bars and restaurants nearby. Breakfast was served in a traditional sullen French way........you've guessed it......we won't be going back!

Reviews.Title: “excelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: erez64
Reviews.Content: great hotel, very freindly and helpfull staff. location is good - 50 meters from a metro stations but far from the center, it takes about 15-20 minutes ride to get to the center which is no bigi. rooms are nice, equpied with a flat screen tv (but small one), personal safe, free wifi and nice showers. all in all - from my pas paris 3 star hotel experinces - this is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: RobertVPrague
Reviews.Content: We spent in this hotel 3 nights in April 2011. Adventage - location, close to the subway, two lines, lot of restaurants, grocery shop - staff (with one exception) - free wifi Disadventage - breakfest area, very small, you have to wait, and they don´t even have extra glasses to get juice or water -breakfest itself was very poor (no fruit, one kind of ham, cheese, etc.) - very small room, can´t even move with two luggage, small bed -price (125E/night) I had very bad experience with woman on reception when I wanted to have breakfest in their lobby room where was smelly air because of cigarette smoke and I opened the window. The reaction was exaggerat when she was yelling at me in french something about aircondition...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel (as expected)”
Reviews.Author: bizbear
Reviews.Content: We were sent to the Grand Hotel Dore after our original hotel had a booking issue and no room for us. We were initially disappointed until we found out this hotel is run by the same group as the Grand Hotel Francais, which we stayed at 2 years ago and LOVED. Again from the time of our arrival until we left, the staff there was excellent and caring. I must recognize Geraldine who was there in the afternoon/evening and helped us out some many times. She is great, kind, and very patient. While staying there, we had a problem with some drugs that got damaged while the bathroom was being cleaned. The hotel management was not only apologetic but took from us a list of what we were missing and then got the drugs for us (they are all prescription only drugs in US) in just 1 day. That saved our trip for sure. And also I asked if there was a nearby laundry where we could drop off some wash & pick it up next day. The manager, Mr Zyad (who we knew from the Grand Hotel Francais) verified we just needed regular laundry wash, dry, fold and said that they could do it there at the hotel. A service not listed but very welcome. When got the laundry and then inquired as to how much it cost so we could pay, we were told No Charge. I could not believe it. THe fac that we got our laundry done quickly and timely so we had time to spend in Paris was great, what was unexpected was having done complimentary for us. Truly above & beyond. The room was fine. We had an outlet above the desk and one near the door so we could charge things on the desk. It had a minifridge with some complimentary water, we kept our own water in there all week so we had a cool supply whenever we needed it. Bathroom cleaned daily and fresh soap/toilletries put out. The corner show was a bit tight since we are both pretty large guys but it was doable. No real shelf space in the bathroom my only complaint. Room safe worked and big enough for all our things (Kindle but we don't bring a laptop). Neighborhood is very nice, Metro access is excellent. Cafe Felix across the circle is a wonderful friendly place to stop & eat and not very expensive. We had several meals there and enjoyed them.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: pompey62
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel yes the rooms were small but very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were superb it was my partners 60th birthday and they left him chocolates and birthday greetings in the room. Breakfast was continental but plenty of it and all of very high quality. We would stay here again if in Paris as the metro is just across the road and getting about was so easy. Thank you once again to the management and staff of this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Value for money, good location, very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Edie81
Reviews.Content: friendly Staff, Clean, Small rooms though, Just one plug in whole room. The provided a small shower gel first day but never again. overall good choice

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a perfect holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Charlie-loves-Ben
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here over the weekend of my birthday and we had a fantastic time and I feel the staff at the hotel really took time to make our trip as enjoyable as it was. We couldn't get over how all of the staff spoke brilliant English and gave us advice, tips and help on getting around quickly, eating well and seeing the sights, but they weren't too friendly either, just really genuine and helpful. We had a lovely clean room with a great view onto the French street. The shower was great and we were supplied with plenty of fresh, clean towels! The breakfast was served from 7.30-10.00am and was absolutely delicious! Including fresh french bread, tasty cheeses, croissants, sweet pastries and decent coffee.The hotel was in the perfect location; in a quiet, yet happening street right across the road from a metro station/line which we found was easy to use to get into the centre of Paris. But we also had enough on our doorstep for basic needs-plenty of restaurants, a patisserie(cake shop-gorgeous!) and a supermarket. On the Saturday we had a lovely, busy market across the road too which was great, selling a wide variety of things. Paris really is a beautiful city and The Grand Hotel Dore is a fantastic hotel and I would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting a clean, cosy hotel with a fabulous breakfast and incredibly helpful staff! We would most definitely love to return here!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lokes_24
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel. Rooms are small but have all the provisions needed and a nice modern bathroom. Continental breakfast good and the receptionist was incredibly helpful. Would recommend for a simple but comfortable stay. Area fine and not far by bus or metro from main sights in centre.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and charming”
Reviews.Author: amanda186558
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from the Grand Hotel Dore in Paris. The location of the hotel is ideal as it is directly in front of you as you leave the metro, so great if you are unsure of the area. A beautiful area, full of charm. All of the hotel staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was plentiful each morning. The rooms were small (as is the traditional lift - room for 2 at a squeeze, but that didn't put us off) but clean and of good quality. Clean bathroom too, with good decor and power shower. We would definitely stay at the Grand Dore again. Bakers, restaurant, bar, metro etc, all within minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 day break”
Reviews.Author: jhlandford
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the hotel. Staff were helpful and everywhere was very clean and tidy. Our room was on the small side (partly through having an extra single bed) but well appointed and attractively decorated with a modern en suite bathroom. We found it very quiet, but we were at the back away from the main road. Breakfast was continental style but a good selection and well presented. The location of the hotel is good - within 50 metres of a metro station with direct line to many attractions. There are plenty of local cafes/restaurants as well as food shops.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: jones325i
Reviews.Content: As others have said, yes the rooms are small, but also very clean and pleasant. Very friendly and professional staff. No complaints at all. Handy location (right next to the metro station Daumesnil), with a good restaurant virtually across the road (Au Metro), and a few bakeries.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a lovely location!! :)”
Reviews.Author: Dougoumon
Reviews.Content: Me & my boyfriend stayed in The grand hotel Dore for 4 nights..we loved it!! Very friendly staff & they all spoke good English. The room was lovely, small, cosy, and very clean and it was cleaned daily and clean towels were brought to us every day. The toilets had free little shampoo & soap bottles that smelled lovely :) The room also had a flat screen tv and a safe which was very useful. We also had hot water all the time & free wifi. On the day we arrived tea & coffee, and a bottle of water and soda were left for us in the room as a welcome gift. The room also had a window that looked down on to the main street, it was a lovely view because the road is full of trees. The location is great...its not central but its quiet and has easy access to the metro station ( 2 mins walk from hotel) Make sure you buy a "PARIS VISITE" ticket, its for ALL public transport (RER, bus & metro)..we bought one for 5 days and it costs 49E for zones 1-6 ( or you can buy a 28E one for zones 1-3 which is ONLY for travelling round the center of paris) We bought the 1-6 zone one because we wanted to use it to travel from and to the airport & to go to Disneyland. Its was probably the best thing we bought in Paris because it saved us so much money...the metro from airport (CDG) to Paris costs 9 euros!! A few tips from me: BEWARE of the people that are shuffling three black round things (one of the round things has a white mark on it and you have to find the mark to win) they are EVERYWHERE and they con tourists...the people that are standing round them are all in on the con pretending they are betting. They took 100 euros out of our hands and wouldnt gve it us back!!!! DO NOT PLAY..nobody ever wins!! ( we saw a couple lose 250e in 2 mins) If you buy souvenirs off people on the street try to make them give them to you for a better price... eg. i bought a photo frame for 5 euros instead of 12euros which was his first offer ;) If you're planning on going to Paris i hope you have a great time!!! just like we did :) xx

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, warm, welcoming, helpful”
Reviews.Author: Sarahmai87
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel with the metro at the doorstep. The staff were really helpful and made our stay very pleasant. Breakfast was beautiful!! Would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute pleasure”
Reviews.Author: griff86
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day stay at the Grand Dore Hotel, our stay was a pleasure. Right next to the metro so easy access to anywhere in Paris. The hotel was clean and fresh looking. Staff were all friendly one in particular was very helpful showing us all must see points and how to get to them. breakfast was amazing something I shall certainly miss. Room was small but clean and nicely decorated with everything that was required. All in all our stay here couldnt have been better I would recommend to anyone you will be delighted.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean friendly hotel near to metro”
Reviews.Author: annieDoncaster
Reviews.Content: A wonderful small hotel idea for the visitor to Paris very near to the metro line. The rooms and corridors were small but everything was very clean. The breakfast was very good although the dining room was also small. We had no problem with any part of the Hotel. Would return if travelling to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in paris”
Reviews.Author: kennedynz
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with amazing staff! So very helpful and friendly. Very clean rooms, although very small did us just fine. 30 seconds from metro station. yummy breakfast. would definatley reccomend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, great service”
Reviews.Author: bigjohnb99 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect, a very good price. Upon arrival the service was friendly and helpful and nothing was too much. The staff gave us details of local restaurants they recommended, the local bakers etc which was a really nice touch. The room was great (a typical paris room as they are smallish) a lovely ensuite and shower, a fridge with complimentary water. The staff were lovely each time we left or arrived back at the hotel. The continental breakfast was great and plentiful. The hotel has free wi-fi which is always useful. The hotel has an underground station within 50 metres of the hotel which is perfect. The only small downside to the hotel is the location, it is perhaps 4/5 stops too far out of the centre on the underground, but to be honest this was not an issue for us. The sights of Paris are all spread out, so to be honest it isn't too far out, it is only a few stops from Notre Damn, Louvre etc. As long as you plan your sightseeing and work your way back towards the hotel is fine, (for example to the Eiffell Tower took 30-335minutes on the tube, no changes which is the opposite side of the city, so not too bad!! Maybe i'm just being picky!!!). On the positive, it was easy to get to from both Gare Du Nord and from the airport (when using the train/Orly bus as both come into Gare Du Nord). A great hotel in summary, I would definately use the hotel again, great value, great service.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD STAY AGAIN.....”
Reviews.Author: WITHIES
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel, room slightly on the small side, but very well equipped. Very good location, close to Metro and some very good restaurants. Would recommend and will stay again on our next trip...the breakfast was very good, selection of meats, cheeses, fruit salad, bread etc......

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel--Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mit110
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel to stay at when in Paris. It was very clean and reasonably priced. We would definitely use this hotel again. It is conveniently located to the major metro and bus lines. The hotel staff was helpful and very personable. The lobby had someone on duty 24/7. The breakfast that was provided was very good and a nice plus. The room had a small refrigerator in the room which was very convenient. We also found there to be a lot of very good restaurants within a short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TonyCurran
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to Paris for the 1st time recently for 3 nights and stayed here. From walking into the reception area and checking in, we were made very welcome. The receptionist was lovely and luckily for me spoke perfect english as my French is not that great. She pointed out all the local eating places and how much they were and how to get a 3 day travel pass for the metro and what zones I needed so as I wouldn't pay for areas I would not be going to. The room was a bit small (I been told that is normal in France by other travellers) but it was clean, tidy and well presented. There was plenty to choose from for breakfast and the dining area was clean. This is a very nice hotel to stay in and I would recommend to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “REally Nice Hotel and Close to Centre Paris”
Reviews.Author: mattid
Reviews.Content: This on is a really nice hotel Tiny and comfortable the stuff are all very very helpfull Breakfast was really nice. Reception open 24hours ;-) Rooms are a bit small...too small! but for a long weekend it was perfect really clean and organized.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: zeeberino
Reviews.Content: I was here in July 2010 with the girlfriend for 2 nights. The hotel is located near Daumesnil metro station which offers easy connections to the rest of the city and to CDG airport. The nearby area has plenty of bars, cafes and restaurants to choose from, as well as grocery stores. We had a room on the top floor – quite a hike up the stairs with luggage but there is a lift – however avoid if claustrophobic as you are lucky to get 2 people in there! The room itself was clean and modern and bed was comfortable. Very small bathroom but with good amenities and a wonderful shower. Breakfast was included and was continental option. Very small seating area for breakfast meaning you can be stood around waiting for a free table at busy periods, but never for too long. Overall a charming, cheap and conveniently located hotel that I would happily recommend and would stay again when in Paris next time.

Reviews.Title: “Would use also in the future”
Reviews.Author: Uuno_turhapuro
Reviews.Content: Hello fellows, we spent 3 nights at the Grand Hotel Dore and had a good time. I´m regular Paris visitor so I know that rooms are here normally small. Our room was a corner room so it was still small but comfortable. Breakfast was good with fresh fruit sallad, ham, cheese etc. Friendly and helpfull staff, free internet and location close to the Metro station was a big plus. Room was silent at the backyard and gave a good sleep. Location was good in peacefull part of city and close enough to Marais with plenty of bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, welcoming in a real Paris location”
Reviews.Author: MikefromMelbourn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hotel Doré for one night; my company has recently established an office in the Avenue Daumesnil so I chose the hotel on this first occasion for its location convenience. The hotel was clean and comfortable throughout, the room well appointed, the en-suite modern, Wi-Fi available and everything worked. All the staff were professional and polite, I arrived late evening and the duty manager was very welcoming. Breakfast was the usual simple continental fayre. Good English was spoken by the staff I met. I was aware once or twice during the evening of the low rumbling of nearby metro trains, I did not find this intrusive, in fact it served as a reminder that you are in one of the most vibrant cities in the world. The hotel is in a less touristy but very agreeable tree lined avenue location just 100m from the Place Felix Eboué which is a typical bustling Parisian roundabout with monumental fountain, shops and bistros. This is also the location of the nearest Metro station, Daumesnil, which puts you three stops from Gare de Lyon and five stops direct to Bastille. In the morning I chose to walk to Gare De Lyon, about 25 minutes, and for anyone who fancies taking the early morning Paris air I can highly recommend walking the Promenade Plantée, an elevated garden walkway running alongside the Avenue Daumesnil on the route of a former railway. The hotel was competitively priced and I would be happy to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: frequentflier99
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautifully clean and located in a quiet residential area. Convenient to the metro. Excellent quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Balaji57
Reviews.Content: we stayed recently for 4 nights and it was a nice experience. it was everthing most travellers have already mentioned. some points 1. be aware that you may not be able to get your room till 2 pm so if you are coming in early, plan to dump your bags and do some light activitty 2. supermarket opposite the hotel (simply and G20 ). couple of more another 100 meters down Av Daumesnil 3. while places of interest are a bit far- its not an issue because of the metro and bus link next door (unless if there is a strike - we experienced for one day -sept 7 ) we used the metro extensively

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant. I really want to go again!”
Reviews.Author: mobilemaz
Reviews.Content: Hotel is excellent. Definitely a hidden gem. So clean, lovely helpful staff who can't do enough for you and lovely breakfast. Yes ok the lift is small but for heavens sake who sleeps in the lift??? Yes there are tea and coffee facilities in room and a mini bar and they even leave a few complimentary drinks. Dining area is a little bit on small side and you may have a few minutes wait at busy times but hey youre on holiday does it matter? We arrived early but were allowed to leave cases and come back later to check in (the same on day of departure). Most attractions are a short distance away and the Metro is just up the road - so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every way, would recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: DigitalGeorge
Reviews.Content: We turned up mid-afternoon after a short time on the metro (very clean and easy to use) and was met at the desk by a yung lady (Geraldine) who quickly establishd that our French speaking was minimal. She immediately switched to fluent English and was the "star" of the hotel. Nothing was too much trouble and she was so helpful regarding getting around Paris. I am confident we would not have seen so much or had such a good time without her guidance. The hotel itself was spotlessly clean and although the lift was small it accomodated the two of us plus our case. the room was perfectly adequate size-wise as we were aware that Paris rooms are small but this was fine. The shower was brilliant and the bathroom very clean and whilst compact was perfectly functional. Breakfast was included in our deal (buffet style) and gave a choice of cereals, rolls etc. Eating out was no problem as Geraldine is prepared with a list of local eateries to suit all budgets. Location is excellent, within 50m of Daumesnil Metro station, one line takes you directly to Eiffel Tower within 20 mins (or on to Arc de triomphe) anywhere else is just one change but all attractions are no more than 20 minutes away by metro. This was our first trip to Paris and will not be the last, and we will be making sure we are booked in here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, very cosy and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: ElvenPrincess_x
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip abroad with my boyfriend and one we will never forget. We are both 23 and were looking for somewhere clean, friendly and good value to stay and that is exactly what we got. The reception staff were extremely welcoming and helpful, showing us how to get to places on the metro, where to eat and drink and kindly holding our bags on our last day as we had a later flight. The rooms were so clean, the bathroom new and the room air conditioned, which were all great to come back to after busy days of adventuring around Paris. The bedrooms are quite small, but enough room for the two of us to put our luggage out and get ready every morning and evening without getting in each others way. I did not find this a problem at all. We got very good sleep, only slight noise from the door next to ours closing now and again and a slight rumble from the metro (but I'm assuming this is normal being in Paris as the metro is such a big part of the city). The area was quite peaceful and cute, a local even approached us and asked if we needed help when we were looking for a supermarket which was just down the road and handy for getting bits of snacks and drinks. Very easy to get to major sites from the metro station. Overall an excellent stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely service, really nice hotel and great transport links”
Reviews.Author: julier2004
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for my boyfriend's birthday and this hotel was absolutely perfect. The front of house staff were exceptionally friendly, funny and helpful and they spoke English which was a bonus! The hotel is located in a very pleasant residential area with lots of restaurants and bars and a great supermarket within a couple of minutes walk. The metro station is less than two minutes walk away and is on an intersection with two very useful lines. On one day, we took a (slow) walk (which took about an hour) along the banks of the Seine into central Paris which was really pleasant. The rooms are small but spotlessly clean, the bed was very comfortable and the shower was powerful. The hotel also has free wi-fi. Breakfast was really good value, tea, coffee and as many pastries, bread rolls, cheese fruit and yoghurts that you could eat. It is about 20 minutes to half an hour from the Gare du Nord by metro and about the same by taxi, which cost about €13. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. We have only marked down the rooms because of the size, but as we were on a city break and not there to spend all day in the room anyway, it didn't matter one bit. We will definitely stay in this hotel again next time we go to Paris. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for Great Price”
Reviews.Author: mosley41
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and 5 days and thought the overall hotel experience was great. A one to two minute walk to the Metro station and lots of cafes surrounding the hotel. We found a lovely place just around the corner that sells great strawberry tarts. All of the cafes' menus are in French so if you do not speak the lanuage, I would recommend that you learn it. Breakfast was very good and included in the price. The breakfast is not like the States with a huge variety, but it was still delicious. The best croissants I've ever had!! The entire is also free, but make sure to ask the front desk for the user id and password. The hotel rooms are a bit small, but that seems to be the norm here in Europe. If you want a room that is big enough for more than two people, then I would not recommend this one. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and the maids came everyday to clean our room. The only frustration we had was getting around Paris on the Metro. Sometimes our tickets worked and other times it didn't. Total hit and miss. You can only purchase tickets at certain Metro stations which was different for us considering we now live in London.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a reasonable price...”
Reviews.Author: caalve
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the hotel and I can't say a single bad word about it. The service was good and even though the staff couldn't speak English very well they were very attentive and tried to accommodate every wish we had. Breakfast was included in the price and was quite tasty. One could choose from fresh fruit, cereals, croissants, cheese, ham, yoghurt and other baked stuff. The only drawback was the same selection of food (every single day)...after 4 or 5 days you may crave for a change. The room was smaller but since we only stayed in it during the night, we didn't mind. Every time I travel I am worried about the bathroom but I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. It was clean and cozy and the shower was really good. I really liked it. The location was very important for us as well. The hotel is situated few steps away from metro stop so that's a huge plus. We stayed at first floor so sometimes you could hear a metro train but the noise was really hardly noticeable. We didn't have much time to walk around the neighborhood til the last day so we were a bit surprised (pleasantly) when we found so many different shops and restaurants just a few steps away from the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel for everyone who is looking for a place to stay while on a business or sightseeing trip. As I already said in the headline...it's a great choice for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel and you won't regret”
Reviews.Author: 3May5
Reviews.Content: The staff is very welcoming! Room was very nice and clean, though a bit small. Everything was newly furnished. Stayed in 101 room next to the elevator, but the nights were very silent. From your bed you can see the boulevard. Great view. No noise. Subway station 20 m from the hotel. Very good connection to train station and easy access to all tourist spots. The neighbourhood is very nice, clean and can feel that you are in Paris. The breakfast was so lavishly and everything was tasty. No matter you wake up early or late you can find everything available on the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: khawes5370
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with friends for a short break. This is a small but very friendly hotel, the staff were extremely helpful and spoke english!!...The bedrooms, whilst not big in size were comfortable, lovely and clean and in good decorative order. The bathroom and shower were really good!! The BIG plus of this hotel is its location, in a quiet suberb of Paris but the metro is only 50yrds away on a central line . City centre just a few stations taking about 15 mins, Tip ( buy carnet of 10 tickets for just over 11 Euro), fantastically cheap compared to london!!!....and an excellent regular service, trains usually about every 5 mins!! The are many excellent local restaurants.bistros etc......Breakfast at the hotel is usual continental. Would certainly use this hotel in future, We booked it as part of a Euro Star Package.

Reviews.Title: “Good three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: hunt4holiday
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of Lastminute.com deal and it is a good three star hotel. Clean and lovely hot shower. Staff were friendly and the ones that could speak English were great. They do need to fix the squeek in the room on the 5th floor as this did lead to two sleepless nights while our neighbours were up till dawn!! The hotel is well positioned and easy access via the metro to all the main sites and stations. The lift is small, two people just make it in but it seemed to work just fine.

Reviews.Title: “"Bare bones" discount lodging - close to Metro. Manners needed.”
Reviews.Author: SiestaKeygrrl
Reviews.Content: I was just reminded to review this property, and my opinion still hasn't softened after all these months. We used this hotel as a base to drop off our belongings before the Fat Tyre Paris bike tour, and then get a night's sleep before heading back to London. I wasn't very pleased upon check-in, when I objected to handing over my Amex for a prepaid room (there were no available concessions to be charged to my room) and was told by the equally offensive manager that the French learned to commit credit card fraud from the Brits and Americans, so I needn't worry. Who says that??? Anyway, after getting into the world's smallest lift with only a carry-on (large people would be forced to use the stairs), we then found we had booked the smallest room ever. Bare bones, firm double bed (I booked two beds-which were "not available"), with a flat screen television and a wardrobe. The bathroom was the nicest part of the room, very modern and clean-but the shower handles kept falling off. Again, it was a place to rest our head, so it sufficed. It is in a safe arrondissement and we felt comfortable walking about at 2am after the bike tour (although everything is closed). Clean, discount lodging. Friendly reception, sans the poor mannners from the manager. TIPS: Do not listen to the reception's direction to take the bus, which is a 45 minute ride from Gare du Nord! Take the Metro which is only minutes to Daumesnil using the same carnets! Also, we found out there was a breakfast available only AFTER we were checking out (turned out to be expensive anyway)-but there IS a Monoprix only a block away which has inexpensive fresh, yummy croissants and other pastries, along with beverages. I personally wouldn't stay here again, as I like hotel stays to be at least as nice and comfortable, if not moreso, as my own home. We are returning to Paris to take the Versailles bike tour in June, and I'll be trying out a different hotel this time.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended - couple of small improvements would make it perfect”
Reviews.Author: LostAndFoundUK
Reviews.Content: I have recently completed a stay at the Grand Hotel Dore with my partner. We both thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We look forward to staying there again in the future, and would strongly recommend this hotel to friends. Location: Daumesnil, literally 30 seconds from the metro which provides easy access into the city centre. Getting back to the hotel on the metro was never an issue for us, and only takes around 10-15 minutes. The hotel is located literally 30 seconds from Daumesnil metro. We prefer to stay a little out of the city centre, as we prefer the quieter surroundings and less touristy restaurants etc. If you prefer to be right in the centre, this hotel would be less ideal. However, the metro makes it incredibly easy to move around. Some nice restaurants in the area (see my other reviews when I get round to writing them!) Rooms: They are small, there's no two ways about it. Ours definitely seemed smaller than the pictures of the standard room on the virtual tour on TripAdvisor. However, this in no way spoiled our stay. WIdth wise the room had a double bed with a bedside table either side, and this reached the wall on both sides, therefore only around a foot of carpet around the bed. Due to limited storage for a longer stay, we weren't able to unpack properly therefore had clothes on the desk etc. Again, a very minor problem. Bathroom: Quite sizeable considering the compact nature of the room. Shower was a cubical, small but usable (despite me being quite tall). Very powerful. Had a luke-warm shower one evening, but mornings always had plentiful hot water. Fresh towels & toiletries every day was a very impressive bonus. Bathroom was pristinely clean, and decorated very well. If slightly larger, bathroom and shower would compare to some 4/5* hotels we have stayed in in the past. Bed: Bed comfy. Pillows small and lumpy. This was the only real problem with our stay. Only one pillow each, and they were quite poor. My partner had to put towels into the pillow cases in order to get any sleep as they provided very little support. We didn't raise this with the hotel but perhaps should have. Air Conditioning/Heating: Seemed to be under some sort of central control with some ability to mildly alter temperature by the user. The night we arrived room was very warm as heating was on due to wintery temperatures outside. We tried to turn the AC on to put out some cold air but were unable to. Therefore only solution was to open room windows before bed for a few minutes and turn entire system off. Even then, on subsequent nights room was very warm, necessitating opening windows in the night to air the room. Breakfast: Cold, continental style breakfast. Very good quality pastries, cold meats, yogurts, bread, fruit juice, cereals & coffee. Complimentary English & French newspapers for all guests provided a welcome addition. Only slight negative was breakfast room was quite compact & on one occasion we had to return 20 minutes later to have breakfast as no seats on our first attempt. Breakfast served til 10.30 so allowed a sleep-in if desired. Would definitely recommend breakfast if you can get a good deal to have it included. Staff: Very friendly staff at desk & cleaners etc. Eager to help and good level of English made communication very easy due to our limited French! Only problem encountered was how to keep staff out of room! We were unable to find any do not disturb notices, therefore staff came every morning at approximately 11 to change towels etc. WiFi: Free WiFi to guests. Had trouble connecting. Would sometimes require 10-20 connection attempts. When connected, was fast and worked very well.
