Recommendations to Hotel owners: 1) Consider buying some new pillows (x2 per guest would be ideal) 2) Provide Do Not Disturb notices for guests who wish to sleep in 3) Allow guests greater control of Air Conditioning/Heating system 4) Keep doing what you're doing, improvements are very minor and would in no way prevent me recommending this hotel to our friends & coming to stay with you again! Summary: This is an almost perfect hotel, if you know what it offers. That is an extremely clean, compact room in outer Paris with an excellent staff. If you want a larger room/more central location, it isn't for you. Otherwise, stop looking, and book this hotel! NB: On re-reading my review, it seems very negative. This in no way was our experience of this hotel. It was an excellent stay, and would be perfect with the alterations above.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JamesAW
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for a 5day sightseeing trip and the hotel was perfect for our needs. It is right on the Metro and the whole city is easily acessable with a station less than a minute walk from the front door. Breakfast was included which consisted of fresh fruit, croissants and other baked goods as well as hot tea or coffee and other delights, setting you up for a day of tourist activities. The staff were extremely helpful and even the night porter was more than willing to see to any needs you may have. The room we has was a standard double and was well equiped with a TV, fridge, plenty of wardrobe space and desk. The bathroom was very clean and modern with a fantastic power shower, spacious feel and fresh towels and toiletries every morning. This was a great hotel for anyone using it as a base to go and see the city. Of course there are more fancy places out there but for a place to rest your head and have a great breakfast this is second to none and one that both myself and my girlfriend would recomend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Warnie22
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely and very comfortable hotel. Right from our arrival to when we left the hotel staff were very friendly and professional and exceptionally helpful (this included helping us to rearrange Eurostar tickets during a snow weekend). Our room was spotlessly clean and tastefully decorated and was cleaned to a high standard including fresh towels every day. Breakfast was great - cereals, bread, croissants, cheese, ham, fruit, juice, tea and coffee. The only minor downsides were the size of the room being a bit on the small size and perhaps the location of the hotel being further out, although the hotel is right next to the metro and all main attractions are accessible. I would definitely recommend this hotel and the service we received was possibly the best in any hotel I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel, single room was ample enough for 6 night stay”
Reviews.Author: HistoricHotelFan
Reviews.Content: I recommend the delightful Grand Hotel Dore, a spiffy and comfortable hotel, with a nice staff. I stayed October 2009 for 6 nights in a nice sized single room with a comfortable double bed. There are no tiny rooms with single beds. At my request, I stayed in a room in the back of the hotel, to make sure it would be quiet. It was quiet and I liked the view of backs of old buildings. The room has a wardrobe. There are no drawers. The bathroom was wonderful with plenty of sink counter space. The shower worked perfect. The towels are luxuriously thick. Soap & shampoo are provided. Kleenex is not provided. The elevator is small but is very quick and was always available. Breakfast was ample, with breads, cheese, meat, fruit, cereals. There is a Simply supermarket at the Metro stop. Another supermarket is down the avenue. The Monoprix supermarket is one Metro stop away, a few blocks away, but I did not get there. A few blocks away from the hotel is the Promenade Plantee, the world's first conversion of elevated railroad into a park. The Promenade is a gorgeous botanical park with benches, and views of buildings along the way. It lasts half a mile or two thirds a mile, starting almost next to the Bastille Opera, finishing a few blocks from the hotel (though it continues as a trail, no longer raised on tracks). All of Paris is conveniently and quickly accessible from the hotel by the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Petite Charm”
Reviews.Author: Horli34
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel out in the east of central Paris. It is served by a good metro station out the front so travelling around is no problem. The hotel was clean and the staff amiable. No problems whatsoever with the room, although it was very small - I think I had a single but with a larger (double) bed. The bathroom again was small but could fit one comfortably. The shower was exceptional! I didnt want to leave it most mornings! Overall a very good experience - we had a power cut for half an hour on the first night - but that didnt even spoil the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Clairekd7
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night and had room 209. The room was lovely and clean with an excellent shower. It overlooked the street but was very quiet. Breakfast was fresh fruit, crossiants & yoghurts, with plenty of juice and coffee. The hotel is a little way from the attractions but the metro is literally across the road so you and be anywhere in about 20 minutes. The staff were very polite and helpful, suppling information and a eletrical adaptor when we needed one. The area around the hotel felt very safe for two women travelling alone, with cafe's and bars nearby and the reception is manned 24hours a day. I would definatelty stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but incredibly clean...”
Reviews.Author: LVFuzz
Reviews.Content: To begin this review, my trip to Paris was specfically for sight-seeing. The Hotel was merely a place to sleep...That being said, this hotel is very clean, very comfortable, & has great access to the Metro. The room was very tiny, but I expected it to be, since it was Europe. There was a breakfast offered, but right next door to the hotel is a nice, little bakery that was much cheaper. If you are going to Paris for a incredibly romantic event, I'd recommend a different hotel, but if you are looking for somewhere well worth the cost, that is truly for the purpose of sleeping & cleaning up for the next day, then the Grand Hotel D'Ore is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “great value & quiet”
Reviews.Author: morgandNewZealand
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of reviews I had seen on trip advisor. It was just as I had imagined. It was so very close to the metro which was easy to use and made access to paris so easy. The neighbourhood was residental and although the street the hotel is on is a main street, the room was completely quiet and we were facing the street. It is very important that I have a quiet room so I was extremely happy with that. The room was very small but completely comfortable as we used it as a base at the start and end of the day. The staff were very helpful, considerate and easy to talk to. We were very impressed with the price, the quality and the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted good value for money and nice staff. We had a great stay in paris and would return there tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean but a bit far out”
Reviews.Author: ucfe
Reviews.Content: If this is your first time in Paris, you may not want this hotel since it is located several metro stops from major attractions. This was our second time in Paris and we were looking for something quiet. I would recommend you get the larger rooms (pay a little extra) because the small ones are really tiny. The best part of this hotel is that it is extremely clean! The bathroom is spotless and the shower is larger for Paris standards. Air conditioning worked perfeclty and WiFi iternet was fast and reliable. Front desk staff was kind, amiable and very helpful. There is a bakery right behind the hotel with the best pastries and a convenient market open until 2:00am right outside the metro stop. The hotel is literally a few yards from the metro stop Daumesnil. I recommend this hotel for those who want to avoid the crowd and noise of Paris but be prepared for a 20-30 min. metro ride (with sometimes 2 transfers) to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent base to see Paris”
Reviews.Author: minty999
Reviews.Content: We have just had a four night stay in the hotel and would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a nice clean, friendly hotel that had a metro and bus stop just a few yards away to stay here. The rooms are very clean, beds made every day, shower room/toilette - lovely. Only a single wardrobe -so pack sensibly. Clean towels every day. Staff are extremely helpful, very friendly. If you can book to include breakfast in your stay I would definitely recommend as this is extremely good value - pastries, breads, cheeses, cerials etc. 10 Euros each if not included in your booking. Recommend catching the 46 bus to the hotel from the station - drops you just a few yards from the hotel and you don't have the hassle of taking cases up and down the flights of steps on the metro - pretty exhausting if you have heavy cases - some metros have 3 flights of steps. We bought 3 day metro tickets - these included discounts of up to 35% on some major attractions - really good savings and the tickets can be used on the buses etc. the Au Metro restaurant near the hotel is nice - but a bit pricey - if you want good food at a good price there are lots of great street side restaurants in the Notre Dame area - lots of little streets just off the Blvd St Michelle - usually street side entertainment in the area - we ate there on two evenings and there are little bars where the price of drinks is not too bad in comparison to some - If you like a cup of tea in your room then best to pack a travel kettle - rooms have a little fridge so great for cooling wine, water etc. We had a really great time - so easy to get into central paris on the metro - and would most definitely choose this hotel again - cannot recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfully compact and promising!\”
Reviews.Author: lilyiann
Reviews.Content: room -the room was great! though i had only booked a room for a single person, the room was very large for just one (see pictures). it was not only extremely clean, but the facilities also seemed very new! the bathroom was absolutely gorgeous and promising, everything seemed brand new and was definitely cleaned. the lcd tv on the wall definitely added to the overall impression of the room. though the small entryway might seem a bit cramped, it's not a big deal at all. it was also a very bright room, very well lit! which is something i don't find at many hotels - there was also free wifi! which is great! except the signal wasn't very strong. i had to sit at a certain corner of the room to ensure the best signal. they have a wireless router on every floor though, not sure what went wrong there. but when i went down to the front desk to ask for help, they were extremely friendly and willing to help me out. service - i spent a lot of time speaking with the night manager, who was absolutely great! we had greater conversations and he was, like i said earlier, more than willing to help me deal with my wifi problem. he even took out his own laptop to try and fix it! the morning person was not as nice, but for example - after taking a long walk in the morning after i had checked out, they still let me go back after my walk and use WIFI though i had technically checked out. surroundings - perhaps not the most exciting part of paris, but the subway isn't far away at all. there are also lots of bakeries and pharmacies nearby, even a large supermarket! though someone said earlier that the breakfast is a good deal, i would suggest going to the bakery and buying a fresh baguette, there are lots of them close by. - it's also right on a street, so might get a tiny bit noisy in the morning or late at night... but i was during during la fete de la musique, and there was a big techno concert nearby, but it didn't bother me at all... and even though it was a huge festival, the area seemed rather safe to hang around great place!

Reviews.Title: “Great value - recommended”
Reviews.Author: Twip_Advisor
Reviews.Content: We had a great two-night stay. The staff were incredibly friendly and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel is right near the Daumesnil metro station, which made it super easy to get to the big Paris attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: gordonPerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in early April. Enjoyed the location close to metro and far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Service was great, enjoyed the breakfast and the staff were extremely helpful always willing to help with information etc. Rooms were clean and comfortable (typically small in the european style). Enough restaurants and bakeries around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Ms. Dixon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a typical Parisian hotel. 3 stars maybe because it has an elevator. Rooms are small, but that is typical for Paris. Very friendly staff, very clean. Complimentary slippers and nice toiletries. Good daily breakfast for 10 euros. The neighborhood is a residential neighborhood with bakeries and small shops conveniently located. Also a metro near by, the Place Felix Eboue, an aquarium and the Saint Esprit Church.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in pleasant surroundings”
Reviews.Author: jamestitto
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights with partner and another couple and had an enjoyable stay. Although situated away from the hustle and bustle of Paris it has two metro lines just 50m away from the hotel taking you near to all the major sights and attractions. Our room was small(as is the case in Paris)but extremely clean and well decorated with a modern and clean bathroom. We had a room on the 6th floor and the lift only went up to the 5th, but wasn't a problem as we only had small luggage. In our room the only downside was the shower itself being on the small side, this due to the sloping roof, but htis was only a minor detail. The breakfast was served every morning from 7.30-10.30 with a selection of breads, pastries and cereal. Across the road from the hotel is a fantastic restaurant(Au Metro) perfect for that special meal, also down ave. Daumesnil there's a supermarket and a couple of brasserie's. Round the corner from the hotel is a bakery where you can stock up on baguettes for the day. I would certainly stay here again and recommend the place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Irishface
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the gf for 2 weekend nights in January 2007. The location may seem far out but the Metro makes the distance very bearable indeed. The hotel itself was great, although the rooms are quite small. Breakfast was excellent. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with helpful and courtious staff”
Reviews.Author: Paddysinclair
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit out from the main areas of Paris but like everything there it is easy to get about on the Metro. The hotel has been stylishly renovated; it is small as are the rooms but that is Paris unless you are paying a fortune. Restaurants in the area are diverse with plenty of traditional French fare on offer. We endured a passport incident during our stay where it became lodged in the safe and was impossible to see; the hotel staff were exceptional with help, looking through the furniture, the bedding and continuously calling. We found it eventually but it is a lesson: if you are UK citizen at 16:00 on a Friday afternoon the UK passport office and the UK embassy are absolutely no help and don't think your driving license will got you home either. We were told that we would have to wait until the following Monday!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Dore”
Reviews.Author: nyrofan
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed for 11 nights at the Grand Hotel Dore, over the Christmas and New Year's holidays, and we enjoyed every minute of it. Our room was pretty and immaculately clean, and even though not big, was well-designed and suited our needs just fine. The bathroom worked well and the free wi-fi connection was fast. While the hotel is a little removed from tourist sites in the western arondissements (e.g., the Eiffel Tower), we still found it to be extremely convenient for our travels about town, as the Dausmenil metro stop is literally steps from the front door, and this stop sits on two very useful metro lines, the 6 and the 8. The front desk staff is very friendly and the cold breakfast, which was included in our deal, is substantial enough to fortify you for your day's activities. We would happily stay here again and would recommend the Dore to anyone who's looking for a clean, comfortable, and reasonably-priced hotel. Thank you, Grand Hotel Dore.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: Justyna85
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel with my boyfriend for a long weekend in November this year. The room was nice and cozy, nothing big but you kind of expect that in Paris. Clean bathroom with a nice new shower, sink and toilet ( but dont think about having a shower together- too small) . Hairdryer, showergel, and a pair of hotel slippers :) lots of towels. The bed was very comfortable. small tv on the wall but you dont really use it when in Paris. Everyone at the reception was really friendly and helpful. The hotel is around 30sec walk from metro station with 2 lines comin from it. Very convenient. It is a bit on the endge of the city but Paris is not that big as you may thing. To get to Eiffel Tower(which is on the other side of the city) it took us less then 25min. Close to Latin Quarter. Breakfast served till 10.30, all very fresh and tasty. There is a really nice restaurant outside the hotel- breat servise and awesome seafood. Can't say anything vrong about the hotel. It was a very nice stay. Oh, yes, the elevator is tiny...but if you come to PAris prepare to do as lot of walking :) Have fun Justyna&David Ps. We booked through lastminute.com

Reviews.Title: “Value for money stay”
Reviews.Author: londonnzgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very reasonable price for what it was. Yes the rooms are small as other reviewers have mentioned, but they weren't tiny. The bathroom looked brand new and had a large shower with great water pressure. It is right beside a lovely patisserie and a metro station, I recommend buying the tourist pass, we got a 3 day pass for about 19euros and you can get on and off the metro/bus etc as much as you like There is also a bus stop right outside the hotel and one of the buses goes all the way to the train station if you are going on the eurostar. the receptionist at the hotel was friendly and helped us locate places of interest on a map. The only small complaint was that the doors are not sound proof - as the elevator is tiny (and i mean tiny!) everyone uses the stairs to get to their rooms, and you can hear people going up and down all night long which was a bit annoying. but other than that i definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly "Grand" but very nice”
Reviews.Author: AlisonJW
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable, clean, cosy room in this traditional Parisian hotel. Nice area with good food shops and a very convenient metro stop a few yards away. As others have said, you need to go by metro to visit the main sites but if you're ok with this then it's a good place to stay. As others have also said, it's all a bit on the dinky size, but this didn't bother me. We booked the VIP weekend which includes a good breakfast, tickets for a river trip, a few cans of soft drink, some chocolates and slippers! I would definitely stay here again because prices are reasonable - by Paris standards - and it's got character. Make sure you get a room at the front though, with a pleasant view of the street, because the view at the back would be a bit dismal.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gy1983
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel as present for my 25th birthday, neither of us had been to Paris and wren't sure what to expect... we were pleasently suprised! We flew out of Liverpool with Easyjet at 6am and arrived at the hotel around 11am (Paris time). We were warmly greeted by the reception staff who took our luggage from us and gave us a map of Paris with all the attractions on it and easily marked. This became our "bible" for the weekend. He showed us which Metro lines got us where and which bus routes to take. The Metro stop is right outside and is very handly to get you anywhere and everywhere in a reasonable time, although you did usually have to change lines but only once. It is clean and reliable. We got passes from the station at CDG airport for 3 days which cost around 38 euros and is worth every cent. It can be used on every tram,train and bus. We had a wander up the Seine and headed back to the hotel around 3pm to check in. The lift can only fit 1 person and a medium sized suitcase but you could probably squeeze more in if necessary. Our room was on the 4th floor with a view over the road. You can slightly heard the Metro underneath the hotel but it was nothing more than a low rumble. The room is very small with only a narrow walkway around the bed but it is a comfortable, cosy room, ideal for people who are us going to be in the room to sleep and freshen up. The slippers are also a very welcoming comfort after a long day wandering the streets and sights of Paris. Breakfast is also lovely, although eating ham and cheese at breakfast felt a bit strange! Our only complaints were the price of drinks (6 euros for a not-exact pint of beer!!) but we found a supermarket a little further a long from the hotel and it was cheaper to get alcohol from there (3 bottles of beer and 3 bottles of smirrnoff ice - just under 8 euros). The other thing wich isn't really a complaint but an annoyance was the RER to the airport was on strike on the day we were due to fly back home. We only found this out when we got to the Metro station. The alternates are get a Metro to Opera and get the "Roissybus" which would take over an hour and you are likely to get stuck in traffic or get a taxi. We ordered ours back at the hotel, it arrived in less than 5 mins and we arrived at the airport in 30 mins! It cost 36 euros which works out around £25 and at least we knew we were there in time for the flight. We recommend going up the Eiffel Tower and is definately worth the long queue and the 12 euro admission fee, the view is amazing even though i am scared of hieghts! A boat trip down the Seine in also nice (11 euro - from Pont Neuf). All in all, a really nice and relaxing break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little haven”
Reviews.Author: rosebug
Reviews.Content: Located in Daumesnil, 12th arondissement, this hotel is on the outskirts of town but metro right outside takes you into centre in 15 minutes, well served by buses too. Bois de Vinciennes 10 minute walk away and very close to Bercy. Lovely friendly staff, plentiful continental breakfast, air conditioned rooms (well appreciated when 33 degrees outside!) great shops/bars/restaurants nearby plus viaduc des arts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place!”
Reviews.Author: veebee4
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel fairly last minute and for the price we wanted to spend most of the decent looking central hotels were already full. Not wanting to spend the weekend in a grubby hotel in the centre we opted for a nicer looking one further out. We were pleasantly surprised! We had read a lot about the size of the hotel rooms from the previous reviews and so were prepared, however I have to say for us it was perfectly adequate. The room was very nicely decorated and very clean! The bathroom was the same size as most other hotels I have stayed in (with a great shower). A nice little touch was the slippers and box of chocolates in our room on arrival ! The location was great, the metro station couldn't have been any closer and is served by two very useful lines..you can get to anywhere in central paris you would want by one of the two. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Our breakfast was included and was very nice, however I wouldn't have paid the price for it if it wasn't and picked something up at one of the many nearby bakeries instead. Also lots of nice bistros for dinner nearby. All in all a really nice stay there and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little place!”
Reviews.Author: hulyagerze
Reviews.Content: Excellent little hotel! Very clean and servıce was very frıendly. We had a lovely breakfast ın the morning which was quite filling.The location was perfect, there was an underground station, just 10 steps away, whıch takes you anywhere you desıre. There are shops to buy food and fruit also lovely bakery to taste french bread and reastaurant/pub to taste the french cousine. I would definetly go there again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Wherever the cheap fares take me
Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory little hotel”
Reviews.Author: antonius66
Reviews.Content: Positives of the hotel: -Room was clean -Beds were comfortable -Metro close by (<250m) -Grocery store, pastery shop next door practically -Price was good for Paris (paid ~170 Euro a night for a 3 adult room) -Communication easy (staff spoke enough English to go with our little French) -Check in easy (used Hotelclub.com and had no issues) Negatives of the hotel: -The room is indeed VERY small. I have stayed in a lot of hotels in Europe and this was easily the smallest. That being said, there were 3 of us (3 adults), but still...the room basically was a bathroom and a double and a single bed with maybe a 4'x2' space of carpet. However, the room is comfortable and if you are going to Paris, how much time are you spending in the room? We slept there and that was it, so it was enough. -While the Metro is VERY close, the Metro is Paris is slow. We found riding the Metro a hassle (as opposed to Madrid where it seems you get around quicker on the Metro). It was to the point where we would not want to go out for dinner mainly because we felt like it would require 30 or 40 minutes on the Metro to get to anywhere good. The hotel is kind of on the outside, and with the million Metro stops in Paris, expect a good 12+ stops to get anywhere from the Daumesnil (hotel) stop. -Very tiny elevator, so if you have lots of luggage that will take a few trips or else carry it up yourself. Overall, a very satisfactory hotel for sleeping and seeing Paris. Not super expensive compared to most Parisian hotels and the quality of the room itself was fine, if not cramped. If you want luxury and spacious accomodations, look elsewhere. If you want a comfortable room to sleep in and crash in and don't mind a bit of a jaunt to get into the main part of the city every day, it is a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “totally enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: montyHampshire
Reviews.Content: We had a few worries after reading mixed reviews about this hotel !We needn't have worried, it is lovely little hotel.The room was a decent size and both the bedroom and ensuite are decorated to a high standard(very modern).The location was perfect for walking or taking the metro . At the end of Daumesnil Avenue is a huge park which is beautifilly clean and has a wonderful boating lake.(It also has a zoo but it has seen better days , but children will enjoy it .) One tip if going by Eurostar you can buy your metro tickets at the Eurostar Terminal (uk) which saves money and time as you can work out your route while on the train .

Reviews.Title: “Great little place in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Castlforbes-Crew
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are small, but unless you plan to spend your vacation in Paris inside your hotel, you should have no problems with this little gem. The rooms are reasonably priced, extremely clean and newly renovated. The stay includes a great continental breakfast. The hotel is literally a few steps from the metro and although not on a major route into town, with a change or two, we were still where we needed to be in less than twenty minutes. The metro system is incredibly fast, efficient and frequent. The staff are friendly and can offer great assistance when planning day trips.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: martinw
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Paris with some American friends and were a little concerned that they might find the traditional hotel rooms too small. We needn't have worried. We both had lovely rooms - a good size, spotlessly clean and newly refurbished. The beds are really comfortable. The hotel is moments from the Metro station with quick links (10-15 mins) to the central tourist areas. The immediate area is typically Parisian on a tree-lined avenue, with an excellent cafe/brasserie next to the metro station. A basic breakfast is served at the hotel but we chose to go to the cafe and watch the world go by. The hotel staff are helpful, friendly and welcoming. I would book this hotel gain.

Reviews.Title: “Firendly but sooooo small”
Reviews.Author: CestrianChester
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this friendly hotel en route to Milan. Very helpful staff especially the day duty manager whose English was so good he made puns! Lift was just about big enough for one person and two cases. Rooms were TINY, in fact the smallest I have ever stayed in during my travels. Had to edge around the bed ( I'm 5ft 2") to get around it and even then I fell on to it twice. Spotlessly clean however and perfectly OK in terms of bathroom it is just the size that is a problem and would be even if there were just one person in the room. Breakfast area was overcrowded and we had to wait for a table so went for a walk in a very different area of Paris.Less busy and bustly than closer to the centre. :Lovely patisserie down the road and a great bakery around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “clean, modern, value for money...”
Reviews.Author: ld123
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, metro very close with 2 metro lines, meaning everywhere is within 20 mins. A couple of nice bars, shops (including supermarket and several patiseries) are dotted around the tree lined avenue. Our hotel room was quiet, clean with modern in decor, flat screen TV and french windows which meant it was both light and airy. The room had a small fridge and had free wi-fi. We had a good shower room with power shower and hairdryer. Breakfast was available, however we just used to pick up croisants from the little bakers next door. Hotel reception staff were pleasant and spoke perfect english. On the downside, the rooms are small, we did not have a kettle in our room and the room only has 1 plug socket. Overall the hotel is very good value for money, and if you are only using as a base, i would have no hesitation in reccomending it.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmmm.. Small is good?”
Reviews.Author: Beachrider
Reviews.Content: Ok, it's a lovely little hotel. The staff are really great.. look after you excellently. Always ready to ring for a taxi or advise on a restaurant... BUT. The BUT is in the rooms. We, friends and us, stayed in rooms 102 and 643. 643 is poky but just about ok for a couple of nights but no more. 102.... Hmmm, what to say about 102. It's really a single room with a double bed in it. I, the fat one, got to sleep on the far side of the bed.. That meant I was the one trying to pass a chair and a table with about 6 inches of space- NOT enough to put one foot in front of the other, shuffling like an idiot and trying not to fall on top of bed or out the window. We looked in a couple of the other rooms and they were fine. Lots of room and possible to sit in the chair and put on your shoes instad of hopping about like a twit and eventually giving up and agreeing with the wife whos' turn it is to stand up! The shower is just a tube with a door and a power shower. Too tiny to pick up the soap after dropping it and, for some inexplicable reason, the staff always put the shower head up in the vertical position so, when you turn on the shower, you get a faceful or it goes out the the bathroom door.... interesting but not much fun when it's cold! The room sports a fridge, very useful for those chilled drinks.. Ours didn't seem to want to do very much. Cool but not chilled I'd say. However, that is just a minor glitch. Water is always hot, windows open all the way, (Provided you don't want to stand there as well!) and the bed was firm and warm. The AC worked fine and the decor was pretty good. Soundproof, (at least the neighbours didn't complain about the noise we made!) and clean.

Reviews.Title: “perfect paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: MuskokaBoys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the grand Hotel Dore in Paris for 5 nights in June 2007. It is located steps from the Daumesnil Metro about 15 minutes direct to Metro Opera. The Hotel is a small family run business. The rooms are very small, but that's Paris. They are well appointed and air conditioned and have separate showers with a power nozzle. There is a lift(again small) to all floors. A continental breakfast was included in the price. The cost of the Hotel is very reasonable by paris standards and the staff are very friendly. We had a room on the 3rd floor overlooking the street and it was very quiet. The Hotel is located in a mainly residential neighbourhood. We dined at a local restaurant Le Petit Troo, after the receptionist made a reservation for us; It was very good and reasonably priced. This is definately a good hotel although 5 nights is too many in such a small room.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: nikwheatley
Reviews.Content: Faultlessly helpful staff, clean rooms and well within easy reach of central Paris. Breakfast could do with a bit of variation but at the price we paid I'm not going to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: JennileeD
Reviews.Content: Hotel Grand Dore is a fabulous find in Paris and I've stayed in the hotel three times - once on my own, and twice with my boyfriend. The bedrooms and washrooms are clean, cosy and sound proofed with modern decore. Each is equipped with AC, telephone, wireless Internet, and a fridge and overlook the street or a quiet courtyard. The hotel is 12 meters away from the Daumensil metro stop, and with two lines serving Daumensil, it is possible to be in the heart of Paris within 15 -20 minutes. At a price range of 105-135 euros, it is a great choice for couples. There is a Monoprix nearby (5 minute walk) to purchase snacks and drinks, and there are many bistros & banks in the vicinity. I highly recommend Hotel Dore, and with their pleasant staff, I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura1507
Reviews.Content: Very glad I checked the reviews on this website, I made a good choice! Hotel was very clean, quiet, room a little small, but never mind. Great shower. Very near to everything, walk to the Bois de Vincennes for a picnic! Good local bars and restaurants. Hotel staff very friendly. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, would definately recommend!”
Reviews.Author: jul10985
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel after reading the other rave reviews and have to agree with them. Stayed at this hotel first weekend of June with my boyfriend. It was great value for money, situated in a good location. The metro was not even a minute's walk from the hotel and getting to and from various major sights was never more than 15-20 mins journey. The hotel staff were all lovely. The breakfast in the morning was also very good. The only slight downside was that the rooms were quite small, however they were both very clean and very modern. The amount of time you actually spend in a room on a sightseeing holiday, it didn't matter anyway. Overall a fantastic city break. The hotel was excellent, one we would definately go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: gazzzh
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in April and I was very surprised at how good it was. The location is fantastic, on a nice tree lined street and a 90 second walk from the metro station. The room was very modern and had been recently re-decorated to a high standard and was very clean. It was a bit on the small side, but was big enough for a few days. The only down side would be that there was no iron or ironing board available from reception and that there was no mini-bar, but things that you can live with out for a few days. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Hotel Dore
HotelInfo.Address: 201 Avenue Daumesnil | 12th Arr., 75012 Paris, France
